@FoxandtheFlu @haldaume3 @LadyKiyenz Big assumption in ML is that training data is representative and appropriate for the task at hand.
@FoxandtheFlu @LadyKiyenz Stats also focuses more on confidence in parameter estimates. Quantifying uncertainty.
@FoxandtheFlu @LadyKiyenz ML okay with black box models that predict well. Stats focuses on fitting parameters of interpretable models.
@FoxandtheFlu @LadyKiyenz ML usually ‚Äútrains‚Äù a model on training data to predict out of sample test data. Parameters usually ignored.
@FoxandtheFlu @BecomingDataSci @ClausWilke @LadyKiyenz Machine learning focuses on prediction
column4: while stats focuses on parameter inference.
